014package org.microbean.event;
015
016import java.util.SequencedSet;
017
018import javax.lang.model.element.Element;
019
020import org.microbean.assign.Aggregate;
021import org.microbean.assign.AttributedElement;
022import org.microbean.assign.AttributedType;
023import org.microbean.assign.AttributedTyped;
024
025import org.microbean.bean.ReferencesSelector;
026
027/**
028 * An {@link java.util.EventListener EventListener}, an {@link Aggregate}, and an {@link AttributedTyped} that
029 * {@linkplain #eventReceived(Object, ReferencesSelector) receives} <dfn>events</dfn>.
030 *
031 * @param <R> the result of reception; almost always {@link Void}
032 *
033 * @param <E> the event type
034 *
035 * @author <a href="https://about.me/lairdnelson" target="_top">Laird Nelson</a>
036 *
037 * @see Events
038 */
039// Used for receiving events.
040//
041// TODO: IntEventListener, BooleanEventListener, etc.?
042//
043// <R> is almost always Void.
044// <E> is the event type.
045//
046// I know this looks like a Bean, but it is not. Specifically, the dependencies here are not thsoe required to create
047// the EventListener, but those required to receive the event.
048//
049// Given:
050//
051//   private void onEvent(@Observes /* or similar */ String e, @Complicated Frob f) {}
052//
053// * R is Void
054// * E is String
055// * dependencies() includes VariableElement-representing-f and nothing else
056// * eventDependency() includes VariableElement-representing-e and nothing else
057// * receive() calls onEvent() supplying it with event and a @Complicated Frob acquired via r
058//
059// TODO: Does this actually need to be an AttributedTyped?
060public interface EventListener<R, E> extends AttributedTyped, Aggregate, java.util.EventListener {
061
062  /**
063   * Returns a non-{@code null}, determinate {@link AttributedType} describing the kinds of events this {@link
064   * EventListener} is prepared to handle.
065   *
066   * <p>The default implementation of this method extracts this information from an invocation of the {@link
067   * #eventDependency()} method ({@linkplain #eventDependency() <i>q.v.</i>}).</p>
068   *
069   * @return a non-{@code null}, determinate {@link AttributedType}
070   *
071   * @exception NullPointerException if the default implementation of this method receives a {@code null} return value
072   * from an invocation of the {@link #eventDependency()} method
073   *
074   * @see #eventDependency()
075   */
076  @Override // AttributedTypedAggregate (AttributedTyped)
077  public default AttributedType attributedType() {
078    return this.eventDependency().attributedType();
079  }
080  
081  /**
082   * Returns a non-{@code null}, determinate, immutable {@link SequencedSet} of {@link AttributedElement}s representing
083   * dependencies this {@link EventListener} has that must be resolved before any invocation of the {@link
084   * #eventReceived(Object, ReferencesSelector)} method may properly occur.
085   *
086   * <p>Implementations of this method must not include a result of any invocation of the {@link #eventDependency()}
087   * method as an element of the return value.</p>
088   *
089   * <p>The default implementation of this method returns an {@linkplain SequencedSet#isEmpty() empty} {@link
090   * SequencedSet}. Overrides are expected.</p>
091   *
092   * @return a non-{@code null}, determinate, immutable {@link SequencedSet} of {@link AttributedElement}s
093   *
094   * @see #eventReceived(Object, ReferencesSelector)
095   *
096   * @see #eventDependency()
097   */
098  // Returns dependencies that are not the event dependency. These are resolved by the system. Think of an observer
099  // method with an observed parameter and other parameters. The other parameters are these dependencies.
100  @Override // AttributedTypedAggregate (Aggregate)
101  public default SequencedSet<AttributedElement> dependencies() {
102    return Aggregate.super.dependencies();
103  }
104
105  /**
106   * Returns a non-{@code null}, determinate {@link AttributedElement} representing the program element for which an
107   * event is destined.
108   *
109   * <p>The result of an invocation of this method must not appear as an element of the return value of an invocation of
110   * the {@link #dependencies()} method.</p>
111   *
112   * <p>Note that the default implementation of the {@link #attributedType()} method calls this method and requires it
113   * to return a non-{@code null} value.</p>
114   *
115   * @return a non-{@code null}, determinate {@link AttributedElement}
116   *
117   * @see #dependencies()
118   */
119  // An AttributedElement describing the event event "slot" (the observed parameter).
120  // Conceptually just another dependency (see dependencies()) but it is supplied by the user, not the system.
121  // Normally a method parameter.
122  // T's argument (the event event type) must be among its types.
123  public AttributedElement eventDependency();
124
125  /**
126   * Receives and handles an event, normally as delivered by an invocation of the {@link Events#fire(TypeMirror, List,
127   * Object, ReferencesSelector)} method, returning the result (which is often {@link Void} ({@code null})).
128   *
129   * @param event the event; must not be {@code null}
130   *
131   * @param r a {@link ReferencesSelector} typically used to {@linkplain #assign(java.util.Function) assign} {@linkplain
132   * #dependencies() dependencies}; must not be {@code null}
133   *
134   * @return the result of reception, which may be {@code null}
135   *
136   * @exception NullPointerException if any argument is {@code null}
137   */
138  // R must be compatible with attributedType().
139  // Implementation must arrange for all dependencies() to be assigned, probably using r.
140  // Implementation must arrange for event to be assigned to eventDependency(), whatever that might mean. (Normally a method call.)
141  // Implementation must return the result of reception (usually Void, so null).
142  // When invoked by the system, r should probably also be an AutoCloseableRegistry and an AutoCloseable.
143  public R eventReceived(final E event, final ReferencesSelector r);
144  
145}
